alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Harlan; Kearney (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:54AM CDT until July 29 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CLAY...FRANKLIN...NORTHWESTERN WEBSTER...EASTERN PHELPS...ADAMS...KEARNEY...BUFFALO...NORTHEASTERN HARLAN AND SOUTHWESTERN HALL COUNTIES... At 553 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Alda to near Minden to Wilcox, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station. This storm has a history of producing measured wind gusts of 60 to 70 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Norman around 600 AM CDT. Holstein and Hansen around 610 AM CDT. Hastings, Franklin, Campbell, Trumbull and Bloomington around 615 AM CDT. Bladen around 620 AM CDT. Blue Hill, Glenvil and Inland around 625 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 257 and 308. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
